Reviews.Title: “A beautiful experience!”
Reviews.Author: semiramida_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you want to spend a lovely holyday near Venice, one of the most romantic place I have ever seen. Let's see why: the Lido island is so wonderful, and the place around the hotel is very quiet. (I do not recommend to Ibiza lovers:) Behind the hotel it is a charming garden; you may have the breakfast there, or in front of the hotel, where you'll find a very nice place with stylish chairs, tables and flowers. In fact, everythig in this hotel is very stilysh. If you are a lucky person, or you pay it, you may have a room with a marvellous view with the lagoon. The breakfast is ok, 3-4 days, after that might be boring .The room isn' t small, isn't too large, but is nice decorated. The bathroom is very large and comfortable. What's wrong? Almost nothing, only...some of front desk staff is a little bit unfriendly. I recommend this hotel everybody who wants to have a quiet holyday in a crowded Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: smf2050
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located away from the main area of Venice and is only accessible by boat,however in Venice, boats are the way to travel so it is not a problem, unless as was the case for me, there was a public transport strike. The hotel is right on the waters edge on one side and the beach is located a short diastase away. The rooms are well presented and clean and the breakfast is very good. Staff spoke English. There is a direct boat to the airport as well, so it's a great way to travel when leaving. .

Reviews.Title: “Much better down the road”
Reviews.Author: Elkf0rd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and down the road at the Best Western the second night. We got a way bigger room, and a better breakfast for $50.00e cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel that is the right price but off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: easyeric601
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a nice clean hotel on the island of Lido. It has a 24 hours staff that seems competent if not exactly friendly. The rooms were clean & large by European standards with a modern bathroom. The breakfast was good & plentiful but typical of what I had in Italy. Cold meats, croissants, yogurt, pastries etc... with very good coffee. The internet is not free, I believe its about 6 euro/hr or 22 euro/day. Thats about the same price as the internet shops in Venice but I think it's free & unlimited in some of the other hotels. You will need to take a waterbus from the train or bus station which is easier than it sounds. Just take one heading to Lido. Its usually the last stop. Its a very good idea to get the 24/48 or 72 hour pass, as you'll have to use the ferry every time you want to go to Venice proper. The waterbus ticket is also good for the bus on Lido island. Once in Lido, It's over a kilometer to and from the hotel, but a nice 20 minute walk down the promenade if your up for it. Just make a left as you leave the waterbus stop & walk along the water. If you're not up for the walk catch the bus to and from the hotel. The bus stops next to the hotel. I can't remember the bus numbers but they will be the ones across the street from the waterbuses pointing towards the left. You know when you've arrived when the bus goes around the roundabout to turn around. It sounds like a lot, but not as bad as it seems. Lido is also a nice little area with a small beach and some nice restaurants. Overall a pretty good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and location for visiting Venice!”
Reviews.Author: marct0603
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights whilst exploring the Lido and Venice. The hotel consists of the main hotel, an additional block of rooms and what looked like more rooms in an adjoining house. The views are excellent, rooms very clean and tidy and grounds well kept and relaxing. The check-in was good, with clear direction from the person on reception as to where our room was located. The room was part of a set of four, set in the grounds, opposite the main hotel, which consisted of the bedroom and en-suite. Plenty of space in the room and enough storage also. The bathroom was very nice and spacious. Breakfast was good, plenty of choice and always fully stocked and available. As it is fully self service, the staff are able to keep the food available at all times. Food choice includes cereal, ham, cheese, yogurts, pastries, rolls, boiled and scrambled eggs, sausages, bread, marmalade and jam, fruit juice, fruit, tomatoes, water, hot drinks etc. The terrace outside the front of the hotel is ideal for eating breakfast and also having a drink of an afternoon or evening. The hotel has a small bar area, serving basic wine, beer, spirits etc, which the receptionist is happy to serve as required. The garden area has a number of seating areas, all spacious, comfortable and relaxing. A good place to enjoy a drink after a days' sightseeing in Venice. There is a bus stop directly outside the hotel, which during the day has three buses an hour (bus V) to take you to the waterbus terminals along the Lido. (Bus G does the same route in the evenings.) ACTV is the local company that services the buses and waterbus, and you can easily get a ticket valid for 12/24/36/72 hours for ease of transportation. Well worth spending the money! AliLaguna is the waterbus from the aeroport to the Lido and again this is excellent, available twice every hour. It is cheaper to pre-book, as a single ticket is 16 euro, however a return in advance is 23 euro (use within 30 days). The hotel itself is right at the end of the Lido, and if you are traveling up from the Waterbus, it is approx 20-30mins walk along the water front, just past the St Nicolo aeroport. The Lido itself has a number of good places to eat. La Pizzeria restaurant which is the first restaurant you come to on the main street (G Vale S M Elizabetta) is great value for money and the pizza's are good! It is always busy in this restaurant. The best ice cream we found was at Magiche Voglie (further up the main street, left hand side). The Trattoria Al Botteri is very expensive and although they say cover charge is included, they then charge you a 12% service charge, so beware! also, avoid 'Gelateria Bar Maleti', as the waiter is too busy checking the local 'talent' and other distractions to serve you properly, whilst we were there, he managed to make four tables out of six unhappy - served us the incorrect drinks, didnt give cutlery to the table next to us, kept someone waiting 10mins for their change and ignored a request for bread from another table. When it came to paying the bill, we were told to go to the bar as he was too busy. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the tranquility and comfort”
Reviews.Author: roos_10
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased by the view on the the lagune and on Venice. The hotel was very comfortable and recently renewed. The personnel was professionel and helpful. Our room was large and had a large modern shower in the bathroom. The breakfast was on a large terrace with a great view and there was also a clear breakfast-room inside. The price/quality rate was very excellent. There is a good bus-connexion in front of the hotel and the connexion to the city was easy with many possibilities. There is a large garden and we were pleased by the quiet surrounding. The personnal give a lot of tips for good eating at the Lido.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: Patbermac
Reviews.Content: We first came here three years ago when it was 'Hotel Buon Pesci' and we were more than satisfied. This time around we found that because of the redecoration it was brighter and seemed more lively. Again, from the welcome at reception until we signed out we were always treated in a manner that was courteous and friendly. I did notice that our bathroom shower height adjuster was not 100% efficient, but nothing to worry about. However our chambermaid thought that it was important and had it changed without us even having to mention it. This young woman obviously has executive qualities as well as being thoroughly charming. Everything we required from location, affordabilty, room with balcony, to excellent breakfast were there, and the view, from the Dolomites to the north to St Mark's to the south is spectacular. To summarise, all I can say is that my wife and I found it faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: andronikkie189400
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 1 night. It is very beautiful, newly decorated it seems, excellent bathroom. Excellent location near the Lido airport. Lido is very quiet and provides a nice contrast to busy Venice. On the other hand there are many vaporettos day and night to take you to Venice in 10 minutes. Also there is a bus stop outside of the hotel, with very regular bus service to the vaporetto station. You can also walk there. It takes about 15 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Book your stay here, don't even look at anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: DrCaius
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in June and paid 105 Euros per night. That was a bargain and this is by far the best hotel I've stayed at in Europe. I can't fault this hotel in any way and will return. The hotel is on the Lido island, not the central city island, and that's a huge blessing. It's really quiet and peaceful on the Lido and just a short waterbus (which doubles as a sightseeing ride) to the noisy and busy city centre. The transport runs 24 hours so you can party late in the centre and still get a quiet nights sleep.The hotel is only a short walk from Venice's only fine sand beach and you can tell it's good because locals flock there. There's plenty of room for everyone though, the beach is huge. The hotel was renovated last year and massively upgraded to a 4 star and it's gorgeous. The interior everywhere is plush (including Murano glass chandeliers) and they've somehow struck a balance between luxurious, classical and comfortable. This is the best designed hotel I've seen, I would live here if I could. Everything in the room was perfect, and easy. And generously sized. Soundproofing is great too. The hotel was full when we stayed and we didn't here a sound from any other room, or the stairs. Our room faced the main island and the unhindered view when sitting on the balcony at night of the city centre across the water was breath taking. Breakfast was excellent and extensive. All the food was top notch, for example the pastries were extremely soft and the milk was fresh and cold (a rare find in my experience). There is a breakfast terrace facing the water that offers the same amazing view as the balcony. This is one only a handful of hotels in Venice to offer free parking and it's very comforting not to have to leave your car on the mainland and carry luggage around. Parking at the hotel is off the road and the area is quite and safe... perfect. You won't find anywhere in Venice as good as this hotel, and it's amazingly good value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, perfect if you want to be a little out of the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: dopey2the_max
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really lovely - the place was spotlessly clean, the rooms were perfectly adequate and comfortable, and the staff were helpful. It was a joy to eat breakfast on the terrace, looking out over the lagoon towards Venice. Picturesque! The hotel was the last along that stretch of the Lido, so a little out of the way, but consequently heavenly quiet! There was a bus stop right outside to connect you with the rest of the Lido and the other Venetian islands, but a lovely walk along the water instead if you chose. Overall I would recommend highly for the traveller who wants to see Venice, but not stay in the bustling centre.

Reviews.Title: “Geheimtipp - Insider tip”
Reviews.Author: luckytrotter
Reviews.Content: Meanwhile, this hotel is called Viktoria Palace Hotel - it was newly renovated (only a few months ago, April 2010) and is simply FANTASTIC! Of course you're not in Venice city, but with the "Hellovenezia" card, for 28 Euro per person for 48 hours, you can take the bus to the Vaporetto station and the Vaporetto (boat) to Venice. You're there within about 30 minutes and can take great photos on the way too. Actually, the boat rides are very romantic and give you the REAL feeling of Venice. The bus and boats run every 10 minutes until late into the night. The rooms are wonderful here, although not very big, but nicely furnished, including a minibar and safe and good air conditioning (incl. heating, when necessary...). The bathrooms are done nicely in marble with bidet. Everything is clean and a lot of the rooms have balconies or terraces. The advantages of the Lido: you can drive right up to the hotel with your car (after taking the ferry, of course) and park for free. You have peace and quiet and a real view over the water toward Venice, you pay MUCH less for a much better room than you would in the city. Breakfast is included in the price and it's a very good breakfast too. I can really recommend this hotel! We've been there before and we'll be going back again!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet island in the ocean of tourists”
Reviews.Author: blg8x8
Reviews.Content: When I looked for a hotel in Venice, I wanted a place that is suitable to have a rest between the days of wandering on streets of Venice. I had to take care of also my car. So the ideal place was Lido (di Venezia). From this point Buon Pesce seemed to be the best: easy to approach with car, with buses, with vaporetto. Before the journey my concerns were (based on the ratings): - the breakfast (it is not a British breakfast, I agree, but it was delicious and more than sufficient), - the distance from the vaporetto (it is about 400 from the Laguna Nord line, that goes twice an hour, and about 1 km from line 1, 52, etc., these go very frequently, in fact it was not worth to memorize, and buses start from the hotel six times per hour, I agree, in the nights there may be long waits for the bus) These problems may have been observed in the past, but now we had nothing to complain about. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well equipped. The triple room had a really big bed for two persons, and a smaller bed for one. The bathroom was clean and elegant, however, it is the time for the wallpainting. The personnel was nice, we had no communication problems (however, we would have been happy to be warned to the strike of vaporetto and bus drivers). We had a room with a distant view to Venice, in an environment that is quite elegant and quiet for the price. (And Lido itself worth to visit, if you are tired of Venice and the army of tourist.) One point for improvement: I think the 10 EUR per day for the internet access is really funny in 2009, if someone really need internet, then 15 EUR will buy a prepaid mobile internet package for 24 hour (that can be consumed in installments so probably it will be sufficient for an average tourist for 1-2 weeks when on holiday).

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, quiet and reasonably pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: Comberdown
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with a German friend, who made the booking online. There was a glitch with the booking, but this was resolved. The hotel itself was better than expected. positive points include a quiet location with superb views towards venice, a lovely garden, clean, modern and well-equipped rooms, reasonably priced and right beside a bus stop. It is a good km from the vaporetti stop, which keeps noise to a minimum, but means reliance on buses for those who are not keen walkers. However, the walk is flat and not difficult with a suitcase in tow. On the negative side, the bathroom was very small, the breakfast mediocre and some of the reception staff rather surly. On balance though, it was a pleasant stay which I would willingly repeat.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you are on a budget and just need a place to crash.”
Reviews.Author: Jyri_L
Reviews.Content: The room we got was tiny, when I checked the fire safety room plan on the wall, it did not exist there, it seems it was re-built from a service room or a closet. The bathroom was built into the room and was basically a very cramped plastic cubicle. I'm not a very big person, but it was quite tricky to shower in it. At least the view from the window to the lagoon was quite good. Breakfast was good, I loved the smell of the pastries in the morning :) Location of the hotel wasn't as bad as it seemed at first. The bus connection from the center of Lido was very good, as long as you take the right bus ;) Otherwise you might take an involuntary excursion to the other side of the island and back :) It's a pain to get decent dinner on Lido, so I suggest to eat before taking the vaporetto back to Lido. Well, at least we got a decent price for the stay and just needed a place to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff are theives. Do not stay at Hotel Buon Pesce !!”
Reviews.Author: AOPL
Reviews.Content: I have been to the hotel in March 2009 with my wife and my child. By mistake while chatting with the Male Manager, I left my Digital Camera on the reception desk and left for my room. Upon entering my room I realised that I left my camera on the reception desk. Immediately I went back to the reception and asked, but of no avail. They grabbed my camera within 2 minutes. I begged them several times, but they did not return. I lost all my photographs and memories of my trip. STAFF and the MANAGER IS TOTALLY DISHONEST. If you plan to stay at this hotel, do it at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view on St Mark's Plaza”
Reviews.Author: pollitis
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because i could'nt get a reservation for the whole trip in another hotel i had seen in Murano. Well, i wish i had'nt booked that one to stay my whole trip in the Buon Pesce! The experience was great. It is quite easy to go to Venice by the main Vaporetto Line. The room was cosy, elegant and, in the morning, the breakfast with a wonderful view on St'Marks Campanile was wonderful. Be careful anyway during the night as there is no restaurant in the hotel and there are only a few on the Lido. Though, we found one with a very tasty local food. Great experience as a whole!

Reviews.Title: “Never Never book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan2610
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in the middle of no where. The hotel states on the web says right crossed the road is water bus. but in fact it's in the middle of camp site. you get off water bus from Lido, need to walk 1km, there is a bus run every half an hour. when we finally found this hotel, we asked them to give refund, because they have lied about their location. The receptionist is very rude, call me B*TCH, we ask her to apologise, she wouldnt do it. also we booked the place through placetostay.com, she kept saying some speedo website. she wouldnt listen and was going to charge us 2 nights before we even check in. I wont stay in this hotel for ever, even they give me a free stay!!! it's all lie and rudeness!!

Reviews.Title: “Buon Pesce - Molto Grazie”
Reviews.Author: Patbermac
Reviews.Content: From arrival until checkout, our stay at Buon Pesce was faultless. The Staff were friendly, helpful and courteous throughout. We were even given a complimentary Water Taxi trip. The Hotel is situated on one of the most pictuaresque parts of the Lido with excellent access for the Vaporetto connections at S. Maria Elizabetta and the centre of the Lido, and the view of Venice from the hotel is spectacular. The breakfast is excellent and the coffee very good, the rooms (en suite) are spacious enough for two with plenty of room for clothing, and the balcony view of the gardens is very good. Special praise must be given to the Reception Staff, their unfailling good humour and patience could not be surpassed. Thank you very much for taking care of us.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you can get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: AshAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in the summer of 2006. First, it is a hike to get there. From the airport, we had to take a bus into Venice proper. Once there, we took the water bus to the Lido. Silly us then decided to walk to the hotel. Thank God for rolling luggage. I highly recommend a bus. The exterior of the hotel was quite charming, as it is fairly secluded and right on the water. The best part of our stay was breakfast. The food was standard European breakfast fare (cereals, pastries, toast, yogurt, fruit, coffee, juices, etc.), but the option to eat outside on the patio made the meal worthwhile. The room was clean but a little dated. The avocado-hued bathroom was a decent size. At first the hotel's location seemed to be somewhat of a handicap, but it turned out to have a huge advantage - staying so far away from Venice's sights meant that we had to begin each day with a boat ride into town, and each night we escaped the hordes. Even though we were there in August (I know, I know, bad time to visit, but I had just taken the bar exam so I didn't have much choice), by wandering away from St. Marks we always managed to escape the crowds and have the opportunity to have the city to ourselves for a while, especially in St'Elena. I digress. I recommend the hotel for budget travelers (we paid $67 a night on Hotwire) who don't mind the quiet trek to and from Venice, which can be quite nice, but I do not recommend it for people who need more comforts, are pressed for time, or are planning to stay out late, as the trip back can be long, and public transportation may have stopped working by the time you're ready to head home.

Reviews.Title: “Don't reckon staying here if you've booked it!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrspink
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel had a lovely setting right on the water front, the two rooms (booked 6 months in advance for 5 nights) were not available. No apology was offered at all, the manager was very off-hand and we were sent to the sister hotel. Due to a 'slip of the tongue' in the sister hotel, this happens regularly - so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, lousy location, staff unfriendly, except for one!”
Reviews.Author: bevmeister
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a long way from the point of arrival on Lido for the water taxis; either take a bus or taxi from there to the hotel: too long to walk. Also, there is NOTHING in that area of Lido other than the hotel. Although the room was clean, it was very small, and the bathroom even smaller; can barely bend over in the shower! Air conditioning did NOT work, and in a warm, humid environment, not good. Most of the staff at the front desk, unfriendly and arrogant attitude, except for one girl there-Anne Marie. The breakfast (included) was good, no shortage of food or selection. Restaurant was also very clean. Changing your reservation? You'll pay! Your credit card gets charged immediately upon arrival for entire stay, IF you leave early, no refunds. Wireless internet connection costs extra, and quality of it was poor; staff blamed it on their provider! Bus stop was in front of the hotel, this was the last stop on the route, get the idea? Too far from the main area with the shops and restaurants. Taxi will cost approx 10 Euro every time you go somewhere on Lido, this island is not that big. Bottom line: DO NOT stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place if you're all about costumer satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: marko72
Reviews.Content: This place has some really serious problems. First tip: If you plan to stay here you need to make sure you don't make long terms commitments because they will not accept cancellations...They will charge your card unless you don't cancel your reservation 40 DAYS before checking in!!!!! We were a group of 4 and we all had to leave earlier. We told the manager a week in advance but still, we were all charged full fare for the day we didn't spend there. Of course, they had no problem when I checked-in one day in advance! Other problems: My conditionhair disappered, Breakfast is far inferior to the italian standards for this price, Location:far from everything even in the small "lido" island Rooms are small and restroom smaller The shower plate was always plugged! I know for a fact that you can do better that this in the Venice area! One positive note goes out to the personnel: The lady at the front desk and the one in the breakfast room are a good help and always cheerful...Sorry, I cannot say the same for the guys.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: UKLee7
Reviews.Content: The actual hotel was quite nice (as I had read in previous reviews) and despite the location on the Lido, it was easy to get to using the water and land buses. I made the booking direct with the Hotel's website, at the time of booking the hotel was not available on other 3rd party websites. Despite appearing to be fully booked on other websites, I was able to book 2 tripple rooms for 3 nights on the hotel website and received confirmation email including confirmation number. On arrival at the hotel I presented the woman on reception with my print off of the confirmation. She then proceeded to look through a pile of paper on the desk, but could not find any reference to our booking. When I asked her to check my confirmation number on their computer she got very stressed and told that the number was not actually confirmation of the booking!! She also did not seem to have any computer available to check against. The hotel was actually fully booked and they only had rooms available for the first two nights (not the 3 nights I had on my confirmation). Eventually, after sitting in the reception for 20 minutes listening to frantic phone calls to other hotels in their chain, the duty manager came to the desk to deal with us. That night we were offered a triple and a double room for all 3 nights, not wishing to waste any more time we accepted the rooms â€“ although the double room was very small with tiny bathroom module in one corner not much bigger than a wardrobe. When it was time to check out there was a new man on reception who we had not seen all weekend. I calmly explained the problems we encountered on arrival and suggested that our friends who had the smaller room should not pay the original price as this was for a larger triple room. His attitude instantly turned very aggressive and suggested that I should have phoned the Police on the first night if I was not happy with the arrangements!! I then proceeded to hand over my credit card to pay for my room and drinks that had been charged to the room. He then rudely informed that I had to pay cash for the drinks and that they should have been paid for when we had ordered them. Due the appalling attitude of the staff and the failure of their booking system I left this hotel in an absolute rage â€“ not quite the prefect ending to a relaxing weekend away. If you have already booked a room with this hotel I would advise email or phoning before your arrival to check they actually have your booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MRSSUSIE
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel in the early evening and was greeted with a warm welcome by the member of staff on duty. Although the room was slightly on the small side it was spotlessly clean and tidy through out. The continental breakfast in the morning was lovely with lots to choice from with staff to look after you and make sure everything was to your satisfaction. The bus stop was opposite the hotel with buses running every 15 mins dropping you directly to the water buses for mainland Venice. I found this way of transport very easy and very quick. Venice is a beautiful city and the carnival festivities are something to see, these people know how to party and dress up! I will definately be recommending this hotel to my friends and booking again. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Poopy1
Reviews.Content: The Buon Pesce was a lovely Hotel on the Lido, they were pleasant and helpful and it was nice to return back to the Lido after a busy day sightseeing in Venice. Enjoyed our visit to Buon Pesce and would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: alankielor
Reviews.Content: Hotel Buon Pesce is on the island of Lido. One of the many islands of Venice. It is about a 20 min. walk from the water taxi docks. The island of Lido itself is great, away from the craziness of the tourist-ridden parts of Venice. (San Marco etc.) It is quiet, calm, and where most of the actual local Ventians reside. It is about a 30 min. water taxi ride to San Marco with stops along the way. (although there is a direct steamer to Lido from San Marco) About the Hotel, our double room (queen size bed) was small but cozy. It was clean, and had a great view overlooking the lagoon across to San Marco. Blackout blinds were great keeping out the sun during nap time...bathroom was also a bit small, had a hairdryer. Mini fridge with drinks and snacks that are a bit over priced. The staff was very knowledgable/helpful and could book tours/ reccommend what to do during your stay. Multi-lingual, and very nice staff. Also had a very, very good continental breakfast with good hours. Great, quiet place to stay while in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Voyager520
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice and took the bus to the waterfront and then got the no 1 vaporetto to the Lido which took around 40 minutes. From the Lido, we got the bus to the hotel which took 5 minutes. We found the hotel to be in a very pretty, quiet location and were impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The room overlooked the lagoon and was very clean and tidy. The breakfasts were a pleasure to go down to and ranged from hard boiled eggs to yoghurts, ham and cheeses. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Buon Pesce again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service and Very Rude Staff!! Horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: 12persons
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled to venice three times and we have stayed at a few hotels and B&B's, but nothing has surprised us more than the horrible experience we had at this hotel! When we first arrived on Lido we quickly caught the city bus to go to the hotel. It dropped us off right in front of the hotel( which was quite nice considering the amount of bags we have had to tote around venice to get to some other hotels). When we first walked into the lobby there was an italian gentleman raising his voice to the clerk stating his A/C in the room was broken. The clerk then proceeded to start yelling back at the man. The clerk told the man basically that he would have to deal with it. After the gentleman stormed out of the hotel. We then proceeded to the counter to check in. The clerk told us check in time was in 20 minutes and we would have to wait til then. I thought it was a little ridiculous, but if thats trhe hotels policy than ok. So we sat in the lobby til the 20 minutes had past. We proceeded to check in and the clerk was extremely rude to us and would talk condiscendingly to us. We blew that off thinking he was still mad from the incident earlier. We arrived at our room which was small but very clean and decorated nicely. The A/C was off when we got into the room so we turned it on and then left to go exploring around Venice. As we walked out there was another woman very angry with the clerk too. That night when we arrived to our hotel room the A/C was running , but it was not working. It was very hot in the room. I told the night clerk that the A/C in the room was not working. The night clerk (different from the day clerk) then looked at me and said "did you turn it on" with this very bad attitude. I told him it was on, but I told him to come and check to make sure we were operating it properly. He came and inspected it and basically said it was not working properly. I then asked him if we could change rooms. He then said they were full. I then asked him if there was anything he could do for us and he said and I quote " the window does open up". .....That was IT!! Now I'm mad! It takes alot for me to get mad. Needless to say that was our only night at this hotel and I would definitely NOT reccomend this hotel. Although, during this stay we did stay in a very lovely hotel named the Accademia Pensione it was more expensive , but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: gordyk626
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel 7th & 8th Feb.06 Rooms clean and comfortable.Reasonable size rooms compared to alot of european hotels.Reception staff ok - not over friendly.Breakfast average but filling.No bar as such - dozen bottles of dusty spirits! No snacks available. Which was a shame as it would have been nice to have a drink and a small snack on our return in the evening. The temperature was minus 2!Buses every 10 minutes outside the hotel.Aproximately 10 minutes to ferry. Buses run till midnight. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Terrifying Experience of our lives.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and two friends (three 20 year old females) went to venice for a short 3 day break this January. Venice is lovely even at this time of year and we had a lovely time. All exept for the HOTEL! We stayed in the buon pesce in Lido which takes 1hour and 10minutes on a boat to get from the main land where the airport is etc. Not only this but it is also situated at the back of Lido Island where buses do not run at night. Its scary and around a 50minute walk back to the hotel at night. Aside from small problems we had with the hotel, these faded into insignificance after our experience on the last night. After going out for a few drinks we made the long 50minute walk after getting off the boat, back to our hotel. When we arrived it had SHUT! The gates had been barred up, the lights were off and no one was inside. We were terrified and stranded! We had to call the Lido Island Police from a telephone box we located. It was the most horrific experience of our lives and I'd advise anyone to avoid this hotel! otherwise our time in venice would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time on Lido”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday. The hotel was nice and conveniently located on Lido. It is very easy to take the A or B bus right at the water bus stop and the bus takes you to the hotel. When you arrive in Venice, be sure to book a 72 hour or longer pass for the waterbus. This gives you unlimited trips on the water bus and the land bus on Lido. If going during the winter months, bring boots. During high tide, there is flooding leaving about a foot and a half of standing water to wade though. The restaurants in venice were expensive and the food did not justify the price. There is a good pizza place on Lida near the water bus stop. Overall, it was good time and nice place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from Italy this week,”
Reviews.Author: rsftraveller
Reviews.Content: I was initially concerned about the location on the Lido of the Hotel Buon Pesce, but once there, we had no problems and really enjoyed the extra rides on the vaparettos. Our hotel room, while small, but average for Europe (with a fine bathroom) faced the lagoon, with a clear shot to the Piazza San Marco across the Lagoon others might have a room facing the small green garden behind the hotel. Breakfast was the usual Continental with some great cereals and all the pastries and bread you can eat. The kitchen even made us a cappuccino without charge, just ask. Other reviews have mentioned the staff as being difficult and I will say that we encounted the same problem, however, I believe now that the young woman who was so impossible is no longer there (I am sure of that) the other young men who man the front desk were fine, but all they really do is check you in and collect your key. The Lido is home to many residents and when you get the bus once the vaparetto drops you at the Lido you spend about 10 minutes driving through some of the neighborhoods filled with trees. I would suggest that when you arrive with luggage that you hire a taxi to deal with your luggage. The hotel is too far to walk with suitcases. There is one block by the vaparetto stop that crosses the island and is filled with many bars, cafes and restaurants (we recommend the Roxy). My suggestion would be to buy a 3 day pass from the vaparetto office that also covers the fares on the bus - you will be riding at least 4 trips each day, so it's worth it.(22 euro for 72 hours, vs. 3 euro per trip.) I admit that while I generally stay in 4-5 star hotels, this hotel gives very good value for what you get. There are no services per se, but you do have a charming, smaller, quiet, clean hotel that I think typifies 3 star hotels in Europe. I think it's a great bargain and after visiting Venice over 5 times, staying mostly in the San Marco area, I enjoyed the Lido quite a bit.
